intro: Brunellia briquetii, commonly known as the Brazilian star-apple tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy foliage and showy white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to apples, though they are typically smaller and have a distinct, sweet aroma. Brunellia briquetii thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ornamental value and fruit make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
